<AmazonServiceRequestDelegate> Protocol Reference

The protocol for AmazonServiceRequest delegates. More...

Inherited by AmazonRequestDelegate.

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

(void) - request:didFailWithServiceException:

Detailed Description

The protocol for AmazonServiceRequest delegates.

Delegate classes should implement one or more of these methods.

Member Function Documentation

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didCompleteWithResponse: (AmazonServiceResponse *)  response 
[optional]

Sent when the entire response has been read and processed.

This will be the most commonly used delegate method, containing the parsed response from the service as the appropriate subclass of AmazonServiceResponse.

This message does not necessarily indicate that the request was successful. If the service responded with an error response, the exception property of the response will be non-nil. This exception can be inspected for more information, or thrown to calling code.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didFailWithError: (NSError *)  error 
[optional]

Sent when there was a basic failure with the underlying connection.

Receiving this message indicates that the request failed to complete.

Parameters:
request The AmazonServiceRequest sending the message.
error An error object containing details of why the connection failed to load the request successfully.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didFailWithServiceException: (NSException *)  exception 
[optional]

Sent when the service responded with an error message.

This is a convenience method. The exception can also be retrieved by from the response sent to response:didCompleteWithResponse.

Parameters:
request The AmazonServiceRequest sending the message.
exception The AmazonClientException that would have been thrown in the absence of a delegate.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didReceiveData: (NSData *)  data 
[optional]

Sent when body data has been read.

May be called multiple times.

The delegate should concatenate the contents of each data object delivered to build up the complete data for the response.

Parameters:
request The AmazonServiceRequest sending the message.
data The newly available data.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didReceiveResponse: (NSURLResponse *)  response 
[optional]

Sent when the response header has been received, but before the body has been received.

This method can be used to arrange resources for processing the body. The response is the NSURLResponse object from the HTTP request, and not the complete response from the service.

Parameters:
request The AmazonServiceRequest sending the message.
response The HTTP response information.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.

- (void AmazonServiceRequestDelegate-p.)request: (AmazonServiceRequest *)  request
didSendData: (NSInteger)  bytesWritten
totalBytesWritten: (NSInteger)  totalBytesWritten
totalBytesExpectedToWrite: (NSInteger)  totalBytesExpectedToWrite 
[optional]

Sent when the request transmitted data.

On requests which are uploading non-trivial amounts of data, this method can be used to get progress feedback.

Parameters:
request The AmazonServiceRequest sending the message.
bytesWritten The number of bytes written in the latest write.
totalBytesWritten The total number of bytes written for this connection.
totalBytesExpectedToWrite The number of bytes the connection expects to write.

Reimplemented in AmazonRequestDelegate.
